flawed_nl_solution:
The total monthly bill for 30 Mbps is $20 x 2= $<<20*2=40>>40.
She will have to pay $40 x 12 = $<<40*12=480>>480 every year for 30mbps.
The total monthly bill for 20 Mbps is $20 + $10= $<<20+10=20>>20.
So, she will have to pay $20 x 12 = $<<20*12=240>>240 for 20 Mbps per year.
Therefore the amount she will save per year if she chooses the 20mbps is $480 - $240 = $<<480-240=240>>240
#### 240

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 30, not 20. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
